unnormalised: Real estate prices in Mumbai's Bandra have skyrocketed, with the average cost per sq ft reaching a whopping Rs. 80,000, according to recent reports. Industry experts attribute this surge to high demand and limited availability of land in the area.
normalised: Real estate prices in Mumbai's Bandra have skyrocketed, with the average cost per square foot reaching a whopping rupee eighty thousand, according to recent reports. Industry experts attribute this surge to high demand and limited availability of land in the area.

unnormalised: Property registrations in Maharashtra saw a jump of 15% in Q3 2024 compared to the same period last year. This indicates a renewed interest in real estate investments. Developers are launching new projects to capitalize on the positive market sentiment.
normalised: Property registrations in Maharashtra saw a jump of fifteen percent in Q three two thousand twenty four compared to the same period last year. This indicates a renewed interest in real estate investments. Developers are launching new projects to capitalize on the positive market sentiment.

unnormalised: A 2BHK flat in Andheri West can now easily fetch upwards of Rs. 2 crore. Many first-time homebuyers are feeling the pinch. Some are opting for smaller apartments or looking at locations further away from the city center.
normalised: A two B-H-K flat in Andheri West can now easily fetch upwards of rupee two crore. Many first-time homebuyers are feeling the pinch. Some are opting for smaller apartments or looking at locations further away from the city center.

unnormalised: Several infrastructure projects, like the Mumbai Trans Harbour Sea Link, have had a significant impact on property values. Areas that were previously considered remote are now becoming more accessible and desirable. Experts predict a further rise in prices by the end of the year.
normalised: Several infrastructure projects, like the Mumbai Trans Harbour Sea Link, have had a significant impact on property values. Areas that were previously considered remote are now becoming more accessible and desirable. Experts predict a further rise in prices by the end of the year.

unnormalised: Sources say that real estate agents are clocking commissions as high as 2% per property, leading to a surge in the number of real estate businesses.
normalised: Sources say that real estate agents are clocking commissions as high as two percent per property, leading to a surge in the number of real estate businesses.
